summary: This document contains an FBI lead response cover sheet and a search warrant for a CompactFlash memory card in the custody of the FBI in West Palm Beach, Florida. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations including child prostitution and sex trafficking involving Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the case title as the primary subject of the investigation for child prostitution.

persons.name: Ghislaine N. Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the case title as an additional subject of the investigation for child prostitution.

persons.name: Linnea R. Johnson
persons.context: Signed and issued the search warrant for the CompactFlash memory card.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects in the investigation for child prostitution, indicating a joint investigative target.

events.title: FBI Lead Response and Interview
events.description: An FBI lead from Mastic, New York, was completed, involving an interview regarding the Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell child prostitution matter.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant
events.description: A search warrant was executed for a 128 MB CompactFlash memory card in FBI custody in West Palm Beach, Florida, to seize electronic evidence.

locations: 505 S. Flagler Drive, Suite 500, West Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for child prostitution as of April 2008.
A search warrant was issued and executed to seize a CompactFlash memory card from FBI custody, indicating digital evidence was a key component of the investigation.
The warrant sought evidence for violations including 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), and 2423 (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity).
The investigation involved leads and interviews in multiple locations, including Mastic, New York.
The case was assigned the FBI Case ID #: 31E-MM-108062.
